description: I enjoy using LogSeq but every few weeks it refuses to open as it crashes during setup. This is fixed whenever I reinstall the app.
summary: Great app but breaks too often

description: Everyday journaling and organizing notes and references for books I read. Outliner fits my way of thinking and writing very well. It being open source means I have total control of my data and I can extend it for my needs.
summary: Great app for notes taking and thinking

description:
It's fast, has a great UI, and allows you to import your Roam Research Graph.
You're not limitted in the number of graphs you have.
Works brilliantly. I'm eager to fully switch and set up sync with my own nextcloud server.
summary: A version of Roam Research that works locally

description: Featureful and trustworthy (because it's open source). Props to the devs for bringing such an amazing vision to reality.

I found myself using plugins to morph other note taking tools into my workflow until finding Logseq, which had almost all my workflow requirements out of the box. I am really loving how effortless information input is.
summary: Early Days, but fits my workflow very well

description: I think it's a useful app not only for students but also organizations.
what a wonderfull app
A great local first app that supports simple markdown files for connected notes. Though it could use some performance boost at the startup.
summary: Best app for daily journals & connected notes

description: Took me a little time to grasp, but once I did I saw the enormous potential of this. It's a concept I have been looking to find for a while. Thanks

In my opinion this is the best note-taking app out there right now, especially if you like outliners. The daily journal view seems weird if you're coming from other note-taking software. It took a few attempts for the concept of interstitial journaling and bi-directional linking to click, but once it did I was hooked. There are a few note-taking apps that support these concepts, but none do it as well as Logseq.

Logseq is phenomenal for knowledge mangement. 

My only gripe at this point is Linux-specific: I cannot for the life of me get my "dark mode" setting to stay on. The software itself though is now part of my daily routine.
Logseq is quite good to be in. Open-source and useful.

Best notetaking app 
works flawlessly on linux too!
The application works great in flatpak form. Despite being electron, this is my preferred note-taking application.
summary: Great notes / knowledge base application, electron sadly

description: cant add imaes cant draw simply nothing but writing on your keyboard doesnt work
Currently this would be an alpha product due to its reliability / data loss and issues with unfinished logic. Not sure this can ever reach version 1.x
A great Obsidian alternative despite the fact that it's slower than Obsidian specially in large documents. I hope it will become faster in future. Even in beta version this app is quite usable.
For me, more convenient to use than Obsidian and in addition, open source, which is a huge advantage
It's still in beta but I already prefer it over obsidian. It's more convient to split notes in seperate folders for my courses than obsidian and I really like the block editing method.
great open source note taking application
summary: great open source note taking application

description: tries to be all in one app for you able to write small notes, create large knowledge databases, set tasks, track your time, allow you to draw graphs and whiteboards to better grasp your database overall. Yet it is simple enough to use
summary: all the student's needs are satisfied with the app

description: Not a bad app, but it doesn't work with Wayland. This is probably a problem with XWayland, as with many Electron-bases app.

Logseq is a constant companion. It extends almost every workflow I have in my day and in my personal life. I rely on it to help me iterate on ideas I have, to quickly capture thoughts or notes of meetings and ephemeral activities. It's useful to record information for referring to later in the right context. The developers keep improving it at an incredible pace too.
summary: One of the best note-taking personal knowledge base tools

description: My installed extension doesn't load up when I restart the app. This issue is not present on appimage version, so its maybe the bug related to flatpak packaging.
summary: Extensions doesn't persistent of application restart

description: Great app. Kind of a learning curve since it's very different from "traditional" note-taking, but once you get used to it it's an incredibly powerfull tool.

Most people see Logseq as an alternative to Obsidian, and from a high level it certainly looks like it. But Logseq try to sell it to work "along side obsidian". Something which is utterly useless to everyone. The tool doesn't work with existing Obsidian vaults and just gives several errors when trying to open one. There is no import function. No one wants another tool along side Obsidian, they want an openSource tool to REPLACE Obsidian, something that Loqseq doesn't do. The tool just seems pointless. It has so many crossover features from Obsidian but at the same time too scared to compete with it. Why would I want duplicated features between the two tools.
After a little more than two years with Logseq, it's hard to imagine life without it. I use it to take all notes now as well as prepare presentations all in one place. Wonderful.
I've been using Logseq for years and found it so useful. Packed with features and customizability.
helps organize thoughts especially with adhd and asd
I was welcomed by "Privacy First" but when checked app settings Telemetry and Usage is sent automatically by design & default... sorry this is not what this app claims to be.

Das mit Datenschutz bezieht sich leider (nur) auf die in der Wissensdatenbank, nicht auf Telemetriedaten (Benutzer, PC, Internetanbindung, ...)

Wäre halb so schlimm, aber man erfährt das erst beim Lesen der Privacy Policy auf deren Homepage: https://logseq.com/blog/privacy-policy
Der Programm-Start suggeriert einem das (wünschenswerte) Gegenteil :-(

Was aber ein No-Go ist, dass man beim Installieren bzw. ersten Programmstart nicht einmal darauf hingewiesen wird :-( :-(
(In der Konfiguration des Programmes ein-/ausschalten wäre üblich)

Liebe Entwickler,
überdenkt das Ganze bitte. Mit diesem Verhalten richtet Ihr Eure eigentlich gute Software zu Grunde! 
Ich denke, Ihr wollt nicht, daß Eure Interessenten zu Obsidian abwandern...

Ich werde Logseq vorerst nicht deinstallieren - und hoffen, daß sich während meiner weiteren Testphase etwas Entscheidendes Richtung Datenschutz tut!

Лучшее приложение для заметок и ведения проектов. Классические приложения по типу Notion были для меня слишком ограничивающими. Тут ссылки на другие страницы могут быть не только иерархическими, а пользовательские плагины добавляют много функционала. Единственный минус - нет нормальной синхронизации с другими устройствами.
Poor support for standard markdown format
summary: Poor support for standard markdown format

description: 为什么不能用中文输入法？我在win10上用着没问题，Ubuntu上不能搜狗用不了
